column1: #FORMAT=WebAnno TSV 3.2
#T_SP=webanno.custom.Diy_coref|
#T_RL=webanno.custom.Diy_coref_re|BT_webanno.custom.Diy_coref
#Text=[0021] The rotating apparatus is fastened to the mounting frame by means of bolts 8a to 8d extending through the axial support and bolts 8e and 8f screwed on the axial support.
#Text=The hammering apparatus is also fastened by means of bolts 8a to 8d and bolts 8g and 8h screwed on the axial support.
#Text=Bolts 8a to 8d thus join the rotating apparatus, the hammering apparatus and the mounting frame together.
#Text=Detaching the rotating apparatus or the hammering apparatus thus requires that the fastening bolts 8a to 8d be opened.
#Text=After the bolts 8a to 8d are opened, the modules still remain in place, however, until the module-specific bolts 8e and 8f and, correspondingly, 8g and 8h have been opened.
#Text=The modules can thus be detached from the mounting frame separately.
#Text=Naturally, the modules can be fastened in another manner and other kinds of suitable fastening means can be used.

#Text=[0022] FIG. 5a in particular shows an axial bearing 15 arranged preferably to the mounting frame, which bearing dampens the impacts, i.e. recoil, of the hammering apparatus reflecting back from the drilled object.

#Text=The axial bearing comprises pistons arranged in cylinder chambers 16 formed in a circle, the pistons being connected so that, due to recoil forces, they can move backward in the cylinder chambers at the same time pushing hydraulic fluid to a hydraulic fluid space connected to the back of the cylinder chambers, the hydraulic fluid space being also connected to a pressure accumulator or the like.

#Text=The axial bearing can be arranged fixedly to the axial support, but it is preferably a separate, easily detachable and replaceable component which is arranged to the axial support in a housing made for it and locked in place with a locking screw, for instance.
#Text=FIGS. 5a and 5b also show that recesses 17 can be made on the bottom surfaces of the mounting frame beams for sturdy fastening of the slide blocks.
#Text=[0023] FIG. 6 shows a second preferred application of the rock drill and mounting frame of the invention.
#Text=In this solution, the mounting frame comprises an U-shaped beam with the body of the rotating apparatus arranged to its closed end.
#Text=Further, at the hammering apparatus side of the jacket of the rotating apparatus, a joint surface 18 is formed for mounting the hammering apparatus.
#Text=In this solution, the jacket of the rotating apparatus and the joint surface form the axial support of the mounting frame.
#Text=As in the solutions described in FIGS. 2 to 5, in this solution, too, the slide blocks are fastened to the bottom surface of the mounting frame.
#Text=Means for connecting the feeding means can also be arranged to this mounting frame.
#Text=The equipment inside the jacket of the rotating apparatus can be changed by opening the front of the rotating apparatus.
#Text=The hammering apparatus is, however, a module that can be conveniently replaced in its entirety.
#Text=The presented structure is suited for solutions in which it is necessary to be able to use different hammering apparatuses in the rock drill.
#Text=[0024] The drawings and the related description is only intended to illustrate the idea of the invention.
#Text=The invention may vary in detail within the scope of the claims.
#Text=The outer dimensions of the modules to be mounted to the joint surface of the axial support may vary.
#Text=It is enough that the joint surfaces of the module and the axial support match and that the outer dimensions of the module to be mounted do not impede the use of the rock drill.
#Text=The solution thus makes it possible to use modules differing in output, properties and dimensions when a drill is customized for various purposes.
#Text=Even though the figures and their description only present beam-structured mounting frames, the construction may well be of another kind.

#Text=The mounting frame may, for instance, be made up of a plate base to which, depending on the structure, a transverse plate-like axial support or an axial support formed by the rotating apparatus body and its joint surface is fastened.
#Text=It is also possible that both the hammering apparatus and the rotating apparatus are arranged on one side of the axial support.
